newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft completes acquisition of WebTV Networks.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft completes acquisition of WebTV Networks.

text.p: Microsoft Corp. said Friday it completed the acquisition of WebTV Networks Inc. for about $425 million in cash and stock.
The acquisition came just hours after the U.S. Department of Justice announced its approval of the deal.
Microsoft announced the planned acquisition in April.

The company, which offers Internet service through television set-top boxes, will be operated as a subsidiary based in Palo Alto, Calif., with co-founder Steve Perlman retaining his title as chief executive officer.

Microsoft senior vice president said in a statement the software giant planned to improve the service by using technology based on the Windows CE operating system, a version of Windows 95 currently used in handheld devices.
Perlman said this week he expects to reach 250,000 subscribers by the end of the year, more than double the current number of users. MSFT.O
